triageFlags.title: Credit Score Below Acceptable Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score is below the minimum required for consideration.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application as the credit score does not meet the minimum threshold.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, a credit score below 550 results in automatic decline unless exceptional circumstances are documented.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowable for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: The Debt-to-Income ratio is a critical measure of affordability, and exceeding the threshold indicates potential financial strain for the applicant.

content.reasoning: The applicant's credit score falls into the automatic decline category, and the Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier, indicating significant financial risk.
